TASKS.DETAILS:
Go to start.spring.io and generate your Spring backend.
Add dependencies for Web, JPA, H2, and Lombok.
Run the server and open localhost:8080, you should see a whitelabel error page because we have not set up a rest endpoint yet.

Create a Controller and Model folder.
Create a UserController with a RequestMapping for our /username endpoint.
Create a User model with our name and click count.
Return a simple mock user from the endpoint.
Now when you run the backend you can go to the frontend, put in a name and click login, and you should route to the cupcake page.

TASKS.HEADER: Create an H2 database set up to persist our user data and have the get endpoint return a user in the DB.
TASKS.DETAILS:
Setup the H2 database and a few mock rows with a User table containing id, name and clicks.
Open the H2 console with the url and JDBC URL given in the spring output (Will be something like localhost:8080/h2_console, jdbc:h2:mem:testdb) and run select * on the USER table to see your base data there.
Refactor the User to have an ID on the front and back end.
Create a UserRepository and update the getUserByName in our user service to return the user from the database.
For now return null if the user doesn't exist, we will deal with error handling later.

TASKS.HEADER: Implement our POST, PUT, and DELETE methods
TASKS.DETAILS:
On POST create a new user in the DB.
On PUT update the given user's click count.
On DELETE delete the user from the DB.
 At this point all the CRUD operations are finished and we have a basic working App.
